title: Study in Aachen | Study in Germany

text_sections.section_11: AACHEN REGAL EDUCATION IN THE HEART OF EUROPE
text_sections.section_12: Aachen is international, student-oriented and always open to new ideas. It is also the westernmost city in Germany, located on the Belgian and Dutch border. Two prestigious higher education institutions, the central location in Europe and agreeable size have made Aachen a magnet for international students.
text_sections.section_18: The city hall used to be part of Charlemagne’s former palace. Today, this is where the International Charlemagne Prize of Aachen is presented each year. The prize honours individuals who dedicate themselves to promoting European unity. Former German chancellor Angela Merkel is one of the many former prize winners.
text_sections.section_19: Aachen is one of the most important centres for students who are interested in science and technology.
text_sections.section_20: Aachen lies directly on the border to Belgium and the Netherlands – a so-called “three-way border”. That means you could easily visit three countries in one day!
text_sections.section_21: Another highlight is the annual Christmas market around the Aachen cathedral and city hall. This is where you can enjoy the holiday atmosphere and try the famous Aachener Printen, a delicious gingerbread biscuit.
